showScoreExcerpt:
Take Me Out” demonstrates Richard Greenberg’s skills both as a dramatist and a humorist, and especially as a master of repartee and wordplay. He is such an adept wordsmith that the title “Take Me Out” has four or five different meanings, each of which describes a different layer of the play…. The ensemble conveys persuasively the individual lives and underlying tensions of a professional sports team in ways that have not changed.
